1.text: A false balance is an abomination to the LORD; But a perfect weight is His delight.

2.text: When pride cometh, then cometh shame; But with the lowly is wisdom.

3.text: The integrity of the upright shall guide them; But the perverseness of the faithless shall destroy them.

4.text: Riches profit not in the day of wrath; But righteousness delivereth from death.

5.text: The righteousness of the sincere shall make straight his way; But the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.

6.text: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them; But the faithless shall be trapped in their own crafty device.

7.text: When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish, And the hope of strength perisheth.

8.text: The righteous is delivered out of trouble, And the wicked cometh in his stead.

9.text: With his mouth the impious man destroyeth his neighbour; But through knowledge shall the righteous be delivered.

10.text: When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth; And when the wicked perish, there is joy.

11.text: By the blessing of the upright a city is exalted; But it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.

12.text: He that despiseth his neighbour lacketh understanding; But a man of discernment holdeth his peace.

13.text: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets; But he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth a matter.

14.text: Where no wise direction is, a people falleth; But in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.

15.text: He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it; But he that hateth them that strike hands is secure.

16.text: A gracious woman obtaineth honour; And strong men obtain riches.

17.text: The merciful man doeth good to his own soul; But he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.

18.text: The wicked earneth deceitful wages; But he that soweth righteousness hath a sure reward.

19.text: Stedfast righteousness tendeth to life; But he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.

20.text: They that are perverse in heart are an abomination to the LORD; But such as are upright in their way are His delight.

21.text: My hand upon it! the evil man shall not be unpunished; But the seed of the righteous shall escape.

22.text: As a ring of gold in a swineâ€™s snout, so is a fair woman that turneth aside from discretion.

23.text: The desire of the righteous is only good; But the expectation of the wicked is wrath.

24.text: There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; And there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth only to want.

25.text: The beneficent soul shall be made rich, and he that satisfieth abundantly shall be satisfied also himself.

26.text: He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him; But blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.

27.text: He that diligently seeketh good seeketh favour; But he that searcheth for evil, it shall come unto him.

28.text: He that trusteth in his riches shall fall; But the righteous shall flourish as foliage.

29.text: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind; And the foolish shall be servant to the wise of heart.

30.text: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; And he that is wise winneth souls.

31.text: Behold, the righteous shall be requited in the earth; How much more the wicked and the sinner!
